etymologies: early 17th century; earliest use found in Samuel Daniel (?1563–1619), poet and historian. From classical Latin noxālis from noxa harm, injury + -ālis

definitions: Of or relating to damage or injury done by a person or animal belonging to or in the power of another.

notes.text: "noxal action" noun the process whereby a claim is instituted against a party for such damage or injury. "noxal surrender" noun the compensatory surrender to the plaintiff of the person, animal, etc., by which the injury was done.
